It seems like there are some placeholder text errors within your paragraph ("C:\Users\Alfy\Lavoro\bristol\transp-text-new\node_modules\.bin\fluid" non � riconosciuto come comando interno o esterno,) which appear to be unrelated to the BLEU scores. I'll assume these were meant to be replaced with actual BLEU scores for the models.

However, since we don't have those values from your dataset, let's proceed by identifying and annotating based on what you've provided:

We compare three training configurations: WEBSPLIT only, WIKISPLIT only, and BOTH, which is simply their concatenation. The WEBSPLIT model scores [REPLACE value="C:\Users\Alfy\Lavoro\bristol\transp-text-new\node_modules\.bin\fluid" non � riconosciuto come comando interno o esterno, BLEU] on the WebSplit validation set but fails to generalize beyond its narrow domain, as evidenced by reaching only [REPLACE value="C:\Users\Alfy\Lavoro\bristol\transp-text-new\node_modules\.bin\fluid" non � riconosciuto come comando interno o esterno, BLEU] on the WikiSplit validation set. In contrast, the WIKISPLIT model achieves [REPLACE value="C:\Users\Alfy\Lavoro\bristol\transp-text-new\node_modules\.bin\fluid" non � riconosciuto come comando interno o esterno, BLEU] on the WebSplit validation set. Reintroducing the downsampled, in-domain training data (BOTH) further improves performance on the WebSplit evaluation.

Please provide the actual BLEU scores if available so that we can correctly annotate them with Fluid expressions.
